variables.appSettingsHelp: This is the connection string for your storage account.
variables.selectConnection: Click select to choose a connection

settings.name: name
settings.label: Timestamp parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for trigger to bind to.

settings.name: schedule
settings.label: Schedule
settings.help: Enter a cron expression of the format '{second} {minute} {hour} {day} {month} {day of week}' to specify your schedule. Please consult the documentation to learn more.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Event parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for trigger to bind to.

settings.name: path
settings.label: Event Hub name
settings.help: This is the name of the event hub you would like to trigger off of.

settings.name: connection
settings.label: Event Hub connection
settings.help: This is the connection string for your event hub. Make sure that it has Receive permissions.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Event parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for output binding to bind to.

settings.name: path
settings.label: Event Hub name
settings.help: This is the name of the event hub to which the event will be sent.

settings.name: connection
settings.label: Event Hub connection
settings.help: This is the connection string for your event hub. Make sure that it has Send permissions.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Message parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for output binding to bind to.

settings.name: queueName
settings.label: Queue name
settings.help: This is the queue to which the message will be sent. If the queue doesn't exist yet, one will be created for you in the specifed storage account.

settings.help: The output file path

settings.label: SaaS File connection
settings.help: The connection string to your SaaS File connection

settings.name: name
settings.label: Request parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for trigger to bind to.

settings.name: webHookType
settings.label: Webhook type
settings.help: Webhooks allow services to call one another easily.

settings.name: authLevel
settings.label: Authorization level
settings.help: Authorization level controls whether you're using an API key and which key to use; Function uses your function key; Admin uses your master key. The function & master keys are found in your host secrets file. For user-based authentication, go to Function App Settings.

rules.name: mode
rules.label: Mode
rules.help: This is the mode of the trigger. "Standard" means that the request will be standard HTTP with no additional semantics. "Webhook" means that the request will be processed according to a specified webhook type.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Response parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for output binding to bind to.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Message parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for trigger to bind to.

settings.name: queueName
settings.label: Queue name
settings.help: This is the name of the queue from which the message will be read.

settings.name: topicName
settings.label: Topic name
settings.help: This is the name of the topic from which the message will be read.

settings.name: subscriptionName
settings.label: Subscription name
settings.help: This is the name of the subscription within the topic to bind to.

settings.name: connection
settings.label: Service Bus connection
settings.help: This is the connection string for your service bus. Make sure that it has Listen rights.

settings.name: accessRights
settings.label: AccessRights
settings.help: This is the access rights the client has to the queue or topic subscription.

rules.name: messageType
rules.label: Message type
rules.help: This is the type of service bus message. This lets you choose between using Queues or Topics.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for trigger to bind to.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Table parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for output binding to bind to.

settings.name: tableName
settings.label: Table name
settings.help: This is the name of the table within your storage account to which the data will be written.

settings.name: partitionKey
settings.label: Partition key
settings.help: This is the partition key for the table.

settings.name: rowKey
settings.label: Row key
settings.help: This is the row key for the table.

settings.name: connection
settings.label: [variables('storageConnStringLabel')]
settings.help: [variables('appSettingsHelp')]

settings.name: name
settings.label: Table parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for input binding to bind to.

settings.name: tableName
settings.label: Table name
settings.help: This is the name of the table within your storage account from which the data will be read.

settings.name: partitionKey
settings.label: Partition key (optional)
settings.help: This is the value of Partition key column of the table. The records with matching Partition key will be returned.

settings.name: take
settings.label: Maximum number of records to read (optional)
settings.help: This is an integer for the number of records. You may receive fewer records than this value based on the contents of the table and the applied filter.

settings.name: filter
settings.label: Query filter (optional)
settings.help: This is an optional query expression used to filter the results of the table query.

settings.help: [variables('appSettingsHelp')]

settings.name: name
settings.label: Document parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for output binding to bind to.

settings.name: databaseName
settings.label: Database name
settings.help: This is the name of the database within your DocumentDB account to which data will be written.

settings.name: collectionName
settings.label: Collection Name
settings.help: This is the name of the collection within your database to which data will be written.

settings.name: createIfNotExists
settings.label: Would you like the DocumentDB database and collection to be created for you?
settings.help: When true, your database and collection will be created automatically.

settings.name: connection
settings.label: DocumentDB account connection
settings.help: This is the connection string for your DocumentDB account.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Document parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for input binding to bind to.

settings.name: databaseName
settings.label: Database name
settings.help: This is the name of the database within your DocumentDB account from which data will be read.

settings.name: collectionName
settings.label: Collection Name
settings.help: This is the name of the collection within your database from which data will be read.

settings.name: id
settings.label: Document ID
settings.help: This is the ID of the document that will be read.

settings.name: connection
settings.label: DocumentDB account connection
settings.help: This is the connection string for your DocumentDB account.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Record parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for output binding to bind to.

settings.name: tableName
settings.label: Table name
settings.help: This is the name of the table within your Mobile App to which data will be written.

settings.name: connection
settings.label: Mobile App URL lookup
settings.help: This is the app setting name that specifies the URL of your Mobile App.

settings.name: apiKey
settings.label: API key lookup (optional)
settings.help: This is app setting name that specifies the API Key for your Mobile App. More information.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Record parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for input binding to bind to.

settings.name: tableName
settings.label: Table name
settings.help: This is the name of the table within your Mobile App from which data will be read.

settings.name: id
settings.label: Record ID
settings.help: This is the id for the record to retrieve.

settings.name: connection
settings.label: Mobile App URL lookup
settings.help: This is the app setting name that specifies the URL of your Mobile App.

settings.name: apiKey
settings.label: API key lookup (optional)
settings.help: This is the app setting name that specifies the API Key for your Mobile App. More information.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Notification parameter name
settings.help: This is the name of the parameter in the code for output binding to bind to.

settings.name: hubName
settings.label: Notification Hub name
settings.help: This is the name of the Notification Hub to be used for sending push notifications.

settings.name: connection
settings.label: Notification Hubs namespace connection
settings.help: This is the connection string for your notification hub namespace.

settings.name: tagExpression
settings.label: Tag expression (optional)
settings.help: Tag expressions enable you to target specific sets of devices/registrations, when sending a push notification through notification hubs. Leave this blank to broadcast to all registered devices More information.
